item.title: ‘Stranger Things’ Cast Says Goodbye to the Netflix Series
item.description: Nearly a decade after the hit sci-fi horror series debuted, cast members including Finn Wolfhard, Gaten Matarazzo and Maya Hawke gathered in New York City.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Bahr and Lanna Apisukh
item.media:description: Members of the “Stranger Things” cast, above, said they planed to watch the series finale together.

item.title: Secrets to a Lasting Marriage, From Couples Who Made It Work
item.description: Couples married for decades reflect on how love, patience and resilience helped them weather life’s challenges and sustain lasting, meaningful unions.
item.dc:creator: James Estrin

item.title: The Meaning of Luigi Mangione’s New Suits
item.description: In court before his trial for killing the chief executive of UnitedHealthcare, Mr. Mangione tried out a different look.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
item.media:description: Mr. Mangione alongside his attorney, Karen Friedman Agnifilo, during an evidentiary hearing on Dec. 12.

item.title: The Woman in the Coldplay Concert Kiss Cam Video Is Ready to Talk
item.description: Kristin Cabot was caught on camera with her boss at a concert. The video went viral. Soon she was drowning in the vitriol of strangers.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Miller
item.media:credit: Greta Rybus for The New York Times
item.media:description: “You can make mistakes, and you can really screw up. But you don’t have to be threatened to be killed for them.”

item.title: ‘Emily in Paris’ Makes Its Mark on a Fashion Capital and More News
item.description: “Emily in Paris” may have moved to Rome, but a prestigious award and a new book show the series has left a stylish mark on the City of Light. Plus, a fashion innovator on A.I.
item.dc:creator: Yola Mzizi

item.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene, Donald Trump Jr. and More Conservative Figures Announce Their Engagements
item.description: Several prominent conservative figures have announced that they are engaged this week, news often celebrated by President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Jesse McKinley
item.media:description: Donald Trump Jr. confirmed his engagement this week to Bettina Anderson, a Florida influencer and Palm Beach socialite.

item.title: Timothée Chalamet, Gwyneth Paltrow and Zohran Mamdani Toast ‘Marty Supreme’
item.description: With orange beanies, a roast pig and a mayor-elect, the New York premiere of A24’s buzzy Ping-Pong film was its own kind of flick.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Bahr and Nina Westervelt
item.media:credit: Nina Westervelt for The New York Times

item.title: The 67 Most Stylish People of 2025
item.description: They appeared on courts and carpets, stages and sidelines, screens big and small. And they all shaped notions of style and self-expression.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk

item.title: From Designing Clothes for Children to a Wedding of Bows and Tinsel
item.description: Susanna Treacy and Nicholas Wiegand, who were both designers at babyGap, saw their casual elevator chats at work slowly turn into more after an unexpected night out in Brooklyn.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Block

item.title: From Cuddling to Cold Shoulder and Back Again (and Again)
item.description: We talked about our ideal wedding on our third date. That was probably too soon.
item.dc:creator: Clarissa Perkins

item.title: He Asked for Five More Dates Before the First One Ended
item.description: A long-distance start and a fateful coincidence led Brandon Begin, a BMX rider, and Sara Crisman to wedding celebrations in Paris and New York.
item.dc:creator: Donna Kim

item.title: They Matched Twice. The Second Time Changed Everything.
item.description: Rich Ferraro wasn’t sure that marriage was for him until he matched with David Mansur — and rediscovered a screenshot from their first match two years earlier.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Vora

item.title: Her Drawings Poke Fun at Online Attention Seekers
item.description: Daniya Stambekova has won fans by finding the Beavis or Butt-Head within the most attractive influencers.
item.dc:creator: Steven Kurutz

item.title: Navigating Grief and Joy on Your Wedding Day
item.description: Even the happiest milestones can carry feelings of loss and magnify the absence of loved ones. Here’s how some navigate happiness and heartbreak all at once.
item.dc:creator: Trey Williams

item.title: Murray Hill and Michelle Cathey-Casino Marry During “A Murray Little Christmas” at Lincoln Center
item.description: The actor and drag king hosts “A Murray Little Christmas” each year. At this year’s Lincoln Center performance, he married Michelle Cathey-Casino.
item.dc:creator: Tammy LaGorce and Ye Fan
item.media:description: Michelle Cathey-Casino and Murray Hill were married at Alice Tully Hall in Lincoln Center on Dec. 20. The two met when Mr. Murray had a hair crisis in 2021 and needed Ms. Cathey-Casino’s rescuing.

item.title: The Small Parisian Shop That’s Become a Retail Phenomenon
item.description: With her six-month-old store, Rubirosa’s, the designer Lauren Rubinski offers a colorful take on old-world charm.
item.dc:creator: Alice Cavanagh

item.title: Phyllis Lee Levin, Times Fashion Reporter and Biographer, Dies at 104
item.description: Her 1960 essay about the frustrations of educated women prefigured Betty Friedan’s “The Feminine Mystique.” She later wrote books on John Quincy Adams and others.
item.dc:creator: Richard Sandomir
item.category: The Remarkable Education of John Quincy Adams (Book)

item.title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘It’s Not Easy to Please a Woman’
item.description: To celebrate the season, we gathered five of our favorite holiday-themed Tiny Love Stories.

item.title: There Are Children in My House Who Don’t Speak English. Help!
item.description: A reader faults her husband’s relatives for not teaching their young children any English, which she worries may make for an awkward holiday visit.
item.dc:creator: Philip Galanes

item.title: ‘Modern Love Podcast’: Andrew Garfield Wants to Crack Open Your Heart
item.description: The actor knows life is fleeting, but he wants to hold on to every moment.
item.dc:creator: Anna Martin, Reva Goldberg, Emily Lang, Davis Land, Amy Pearl, Sara Curtis, Elisa Gutierrez, Jen Poyant, Lynn Levy, Daniel Ramirez, Dan Powell, Aman Sahota and Diane Wong
item.media:credit: Photo Illustration by The New York Times; Photo: Greg Allen/Invision, via Associated Press

item.title: Mail Carriers Keep Making the Rounds, Despite a Murky Future
item.description: As the much-derided agency loses billions, postal workers quietly, and sometimes heroically, serve their communities.
item.dc:creator: Steven Kurutz
item.media:credit: Arin Yoon for The New York Times
item.media:description: A postal worker in Kansas delivers mail to a central hub. The United States Postal Service has cut costs by decreasing the number of home deliveries in recent years.

item.title: Palm Beach Rallies Behind a Restaurant Manager Held at ‘Alligator Alcatraz’
item.description: After nearly two weeks in detention, José Gonzalez, the popular host of an upscale restaurant, returns home.
item.dc:creator: Guy Trebay

item.title: Street Style Look of the Week: Spouses in Complementary Patterns
item.description: For a couple from Los Angeles, choosing clothes is often a joint activity.
item.dc:creator: Simbarashe Cha

item.title: 2025 Slang Quiz: Do You Know Words That Helped Define the Year?
item.description: An assortment of absurd, useful and funny words and phrases entered the vernacular this year. How well do you know them?
item.dc:creator: Miya Lee and Kendall Blomfield

item.title: ‘Emily in Paris’ Star Ashley Park’s 5 Favorite Places in Rome
item.description: Playing Emily’s spontaneous best friend, the actress discovered where to find good pasta and more when the popular Netflix series moved to Rome this season.
item.dc:creator: Gerald Narciso and Alessandro Penso
item.media:credit: Alessandro Penso for The New York Times; Ashley Park, via Netflix

item.title: At Turning Point USA’s AmericaFest, Attendees Find Conservative Squabbling Distracting
item.description: “It’s creating division instead of building a movement that keeps everyone together.”
item.dc:creator: Nathan Taylor Pemberton and Jordan Gale
item.media:credit: Jordan Gale for The New York Times
item.media:description: The image of Charlie Kirk, the Turning Point USA founder who was assassinated in September, could be found across the Phoenix convention hall.

item.title: The Best Photos From the NYT Styles Desk in 2025
item.description: Fashion, characters, celebrities, scenes and more incredible moments that made you look in 2025.
item.dc:creator: Tanner Curtis and Christy Harmon
item.media:credit: Landon Nordeman for The New York Times
item.media:description: Lupita Nyong’o wore a powder blue suit by Chanel to the Met Gala in May. This year, the Costume Institute benefit at the Metropolitan Museum of Art celebrated “Superfine: Tailoring Black Style,” an exhibition focusing on the Black dandy and its influence on fashion.

item.title: Pierre Laborde Bags Are Sending New Yorkers Into a Frenzy at the Grand Bazaar
item.description: If you’ve seen a chaotic scene on TikTok lately with people clamoring for brightly colored handbags, chances are good that it was for Pierre Laborde.
item.dc:creator: Sandra E. Garcia and Natalie Keyssar
item.media:description: Francis Pierre Laborde in the Harlem apartment that doubles as his studio. Despite the mob scenes his bags have recently inspired, there have been long stretches of anonymous toil. “I knew people had to get to know me,” he said.

item.title: What Is ‘Functional Freeze’?
item.description: The term has been popularized on social media to describe numbness and low motivation. Experts offer ways to break out of these feelings.
item.dc:creator: Christina Caron

item.title: Move Aside, Snowflake: ‘Theater Kid’ Is the New Go-To Political Insult
item.description: Zohran Mamdani, New York’s mayor-elect, is among the latest politicians to be tagged with the term, raising the question: What did theater kids do to deserve such scorn?
item.dc:creator: Sopan Deb
item.media:description: A stage production of “High School Musical” in Sydney in 2008. Theater kids became an indelible part of the culture when “High School Musical,” “Glee” and “Smash” hit the airwaves.

item.title: Bowen Yang Is Leaving ‘S.N.L.’
item.description: Yang, who joined the NBC sketch show in 2018, earned five Emmy nominations during his run.
item.dc:creator: Maya Salam
item.media:description: Bowen Yang’s memorable “Saturday Night Live” characters include the iceberg that sank the Titanic.

item.title: How the Salvation Arm’s Angel Tree Became a Holiday TikTok Drama
item.description: Is it genuine — or just plain gauche — to post about gift hauls for children in need?
item.dc:creator: Madison Malone Kircher

item.title: Some Newlyweds Are Trading Dance Floors for Video Ga
item.description: Out with the smooth moves, in with the video game consoles.
item.dc:creator: Kristy Alpert

item.title: Paloma Wool’s Rebrand Is Moving Past the ‘Basic’ Era
item.description: Paloma Wool took off on social media with a playful aesthetic some called “avant-basic.” A sleek makeover has given the brand life anew, online and off.
item.dc:creator: Yola Mzizi
item.media:credit: Adrian Morris for The New York Times
item.media:description: Paloma Lanna started Paloma Wool online in 2014. This year, the brand opened its first brick-and-mortar stores, in Barcelona, Spain; London; and New York.

item.title: Oscar de la Renta Celebrates 60th Anniversary With a Glamorous Party
item.description: Oscar de la Renta holds a blowout 60th-anniversary bash. Everyone dressed to the nines.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
